detailsOfAchievement: a) To establish, aid and manage child welfare centers/homes, widow houses, old age homes, leper and destitute asylums and hostels and involve in other allied activities for needy and helpless persons irrespective of class, creed or community; b) To organize health camps, yoga camps, blood donation camps, maintain blood and eye banks etc; c) To plan and workout strategies for increase in agricultural produce by adopting new methods, organic farming and technique of cultivation; d) To work for eradication/control/minimization of pollutions of all kinds like air, water, soil and sound etc. and to organize/participate/sponsor activities and programmes for mass awareness among the people for a healthy, clean and peaceful environment, promote solar energy technologies and its products; e) To organized programmes and activities for preservation of natural resources, healthy atmosphere and environment, plantation of trees, conservation of water bodies, water management, crop recycling for preservation of soil etc. and take measures for healthy, ecologically sustainable development; f) To establish and maintain hospitals and dispensaries of different pathies, to run and organize programmes and plans for health care, mass awareness and eradication of various diseases and epidemics like encephalitis, ebola, aids, polio, and other such ailments; g) To organize/participate/sponsor activities and programmes for mass awareness among the people for sanitation and pure drinking water; mass awareness among the people for RTI Act, Panchayat Raj Act and other central and stare government programmes/schemes; h) To create and augment the skills and entrepreneurship among the rural people and youth through training and education for improving the opportunities for self employment in small scale industries; i) To establish and maintain libraries and reading rooms, science museums and science parks and undertake projects to inculcate scientific temper and skill in different age groups of the society; j) To organize, undertake, support and assist any projects and programme(s) designed to provide: 1. Educational, recreational, social, cultural and spiritual Activities. 2. Employment for those who are unemployed or belong to economically weaker section. 3. Information regarding existing facilities for paying guest accommodation, common messing, Medicaid and Medicare, etc. 4. Dissemination of knowledge, publication of literary works, books, brochures, periodicals, newsletters etc., in furtherance of the objects of the society. 5. Counseling and professional consultancy services concerning legal aid, taxes, duties, property, pensions, savings, investments, insurance, cooperative projects, etc. 6. Sponsorship of those who belong to economically weaker section for institutional care. 7. Surveys, research and studies of the problems of the people. 8. Studies circles, seminars, conferences, fetes, rallies and conventions, etc. 9. Collaboration with other voluntary organizations to accomplish the above objects. 10. Affiliation with other National/International organizations engaged in the welfare of people. 11. Regular dialogue/rapport with Government authorities and humanitarian agencies to highlight the problems of the people to elicit support for the Society. 12. Creation of suitable climate for fostering greater understanding and social integration between the different communities of the society.

title: Society for Development Activities
detailsOfAchievement: Made in Maidaan is our regular program (engaging with each beneficiary twice a week) which uses sports and play to impart Life Skills Education (LSE) using experiential education techniques. In all, we have imparted Life Skills Education to 1807 underprivileged children and are currently working with 2223+ children each week! AbBas! is our Child Sexual Abuse program through which we have conducted workshops with 6865 children, teachers and parents Red Spot is our programme on Menstrual Hygiene Management (MHM). We have conducted workshops with more than 2600 girls and women and reached out to more than 13000 through various awareness initiatives, events and social media campaigns around "breaking the silence" that surrounds this taboo topic. Teen Talks engages with teens through discussion forums on puberty, relationships, sexuality, body image, safe use of social media and anything else that the participants wish to discuss but have no one to discuss these issues with! We have conducted such discussion forums with more than 1230 adolescent girls and boys.
